revised_title: A New Mode of Respiration in the Myriapoda: The Scutigeridae
tldr: The author investigates the respiratory system of the Scutigeridae, a group of myriapods, and discovers a unique mode of respiration involving a series of organs in the dorsal scales. These organs consist of an air sac and branching tubes that open into the pericardial space, suggesting a respiratory function. This finding challenges existing accounts of respiration in myriapods and has implications for understanding their morphology.
